repos.name: orchestrator
repos.description: A lightweight bash autonomous coding agents orchestrator.
repos.summary: A lightweight bash-based orchestrator that manages autonomous coding agents across specialized profiles, routing tasks from a central YAML file and delegating work to CLI tools like Claude, Codex, and OpenCode with full tool access. Tasks flow through a clear state model from creation through execution and review, with support for subtask delegation and persistent context management. Built with minimal dependencies (yq, jq, just, python3) and installable via Homebrew for easy integration into existing workflows.

repos.name: skills
repos.description: A collection of independent, self-contained skills for AI agents.
repos.summary: A collection of independent, self-contained skills for AI agents where each skill lives in its own directory with documentation and configuration via environment variables. Skills follow the Agent Skills open standard and can be installed across different agent platforms including Claude Code, Codex, and OpenClaw. The setup script handles dependency checking, API key configuration, and smoke tests to make installation straightforward.

repos.name: claudio
repos.description: Personal clawdbot with memory, subagents, cron schedules, projects and configurations.

repos.name: homebrew-tap
repos.description: Homebrew tap for orchestrator

repos.name: meshbot
repos.description: Friendly bot that can autonomously handle tasks or delegate to its smarter friends.
repos.summary: A multi-agent orchestration framework that coordinates autonomous tasks across specialized agents (planner, coder, reviewer, tester) with support for parallel execution, scheduling, and dynamic agent creation. Built on pi libraries with Telegram/Discord integration, queue management, and configurable persistence for reliable task delegation and workflow execution. Designed for experimental use with flexible routing between agents and subagent-style isolated execution modes.

repos.name: smart-money-concepts
repos.description: A TypeScript implementation of Smart Money Concepts (SMC) / ICT methodology for market structure analysis. Detects order blocks, fair value gaps, breaks of structure, changes of character, liquidity grabs, and more.
repos.summary: A TypeScript library that implements Smart Money Concepts (SMC) and ICT market structure analysis, detecting order blocks, fair value gaps, breaks of structure, and other trading patterns from OHLCV candle data with zero runtime dependencies. It provides real-time and bulk processing capabilities for both live trading and backtesting scenarios, offering methods to query market bias, zones, and order blocks for algorithmic trading systems.

repos.name: content-course
repos.description: Content Course landing page with Stripe & Solana payments
repos.summary: A high-converting landing page for selling digital courses that accepts payments through both Stripe and Solana, built with Nuxt.js 3 and Tailwind CSS. The page offers dual payment options optimized for global reach and crypto-native audiences, with optional Supabase integration for course access management. Features include responsive design, security with webhook verification, and conversion-optimized pricing and copy.

repos.name: portfolio-guardian-saas
repos.description: Portfolio Guardian SaaS - Monitor your Solana portfolio 24/7 with AI-powered insights
repos.summary: A full-stack SaaS application built with Nuxt.js and Supabase that enables users to monitor their Solana portfolios in real-time with AI-powered insights, P&L tracking, and automated alerts via Telegram. The platform offers subscription-based tiers (Free, Pro, Business) with features like multi-wallet support, position tracking, and historical data analysis, deployable to Vercel.

repos.name: quant
repos.summary: A quantitative finance or trading system. The minimal README suggests an early-stage project, likely for financial analysis, algorithmic trading, or quantitative modeling.

repos.name: mind
repos.description: mind palace / writing / notes

repos.name: bot
repos.summary: A TypeScript cryptocurrency trading bot that supports multiple technical analysis strategies and trade execution across different exchanges and protocols using CCXT. It provides a flexible framework for developing, testing, and deploying strategies with features including real-time market data fetching, continuous candle streaming, Smart Money Concepts analysis, and YAML-based configuration. The project includes backtesting capabilities and a Justfile for easy command management.

repos.name: passive-trading
repos.summary: A cryptocurrency trading bot written in Python and Rust that operates on perpetual futures derivatives markets across multiple exchanges by automatically creating and cancelling limit orders using a contrarian market-making strategy inspired by Martingale betting. It doubles down on losing positions using grid-based entries, trailing orders, and a forager feature to select volatile markets, while including a backtester and optimizer for strategy validation and improvement.

repos.name: trader-smith
repos.summary: A comprehensive, modular autonomous trading agent for Hyperliquid perpetual futures featuring advanced market-making strategies, multi-layer risk management, and real-time monitoring. The v2.0 architecture refactors the codebase from monolithic to modular design with improved error handling, type safety, and enhanced dashboard capabilities. Designed for sophisticated trading operations while requiring careful risk management given its ability to autonomously trade with real money on live markets.

repos.name: solana-vault-example
repos.description: A minimal Solana-based tokenized vault implementation that accepts user deposits, mints vault shares (ERC-4626 style), and enables authorized investment into third-party protocols via Cross-Program Invocation (CPI)
repos.summary: A minimal Solana-based tokenized vault implementation that accepts user deposits, mints vault shares using ERC-4626 style exchange rate math, and enables authorized accounts to invest vault assets into third-party protocols via Cross-Program Invocation. The system uses SPL Token for vault assets and SPL Token-2022 for share tokens, with a dual-program architecture consisting of a main Vault Program and a Protocol Adapter Program for demonstrating CPI integration.

repos.name: private
repos.summary: A collection of utilities for managing privacy and data backup operations. The project provides tools and scripts to help users securely handle sensitive information and maintain reliable backups of their data.

repos.name: portfolio
repos.description: Portfolio Manager with multiple strategies with backtests, allocation checks + warning, suggestions for increase/decrease/exit/hedge positions. Deploy strategy using Docker. Built with rust with main focus execution on Solana, using Perps, borrow/lend and yield protocols.
repos.summary: A Rust-based portfolio manager that executes multiple trading strategies on Solana with support for perpetual futures, lending/borrowing, and yield protocols. It provides backtesting capabilities, allocation monitoring with warnings, and actionable position suggestions (increase, decrease, exit, hedge). The system deploys via Docker for easy strategy execution and management.

repos.name: home
repos.description: Home Containers
repos.summary: A collection of containerized services for running a home server. This project provides Docker-based configurations for deploying and managing multiple services on a personal server infrastructure.

repos.name: lulo-cpi-example
repos.description: Lulo Example CPI Integration
repos.summary: A Solana program demonstrating user vaults that integrate with Lulo protocol via CPI, allowing users to deposit funds, transfer them to earn interest, and withdraw either directly or asynchronously depending on vault liquidity. The example showcases how to build composable DeFi applications that leverage external protocols for yield generation while maintaining user-controlled vault accounts.

repos.name: bliv
repos.summary: A Solana-based DeFi protocol called bliv that aims to liberate yields, built with Anchor smart contracts and a Next.js frontend, deployed on Vercel at bliv-app.vercel.app. The project includes a local development environment with a validator, demo markets, and a CLI tool for token management. It requires Rust, Node.js, Solana, and Anchor tools, with development managed through a Justfile containing commands for building, testing, and running the application.

repos.name: bean
repos.description: Personal (or not) finance, accounting, defi/quant investments, projects and ideas.
repos.summary: Personal finance and accounting ledger built with Beancount for tracking transactions, combined with quantitative investment tools including stock screeners, portfolio analysis, and factor-based ranking systems. The project integrates financial data from multiple sources (B3, Yahoo, Nasdaq) and includes a knowledge base, Jupiter notebooks, and automated invoice generation.

repos.name: mev
repos.summary: A Rust starter template for building MEV bots on Solana that provides pre-configured searcher and geyser protobufs from Jito Labs with pinned dependencies. Includes a reference backrun arbitrage bot implementation that monitors the mempool for large trades and executes profitable circular arbitrage strategies across Raydium, Orca, and other DEX platforms.

repos.name: defi-automator
repos.description: Manage your DeFi like a quant fund
repos.summary: A tool for automating DeFi portfolio management on Solana's Orca Whirlpools, enabling users to create positions based on algorithms with automatic rebalancing and fee/reward collection. Currently supports strategies like One Tick Lower and One Tick Upper, with plans to expand to additional protocols and chains.

repos.name: solana-nft-marketplace
repos.description: NFT marketplace contract on Solana
repos.summary: Solana NFT marketplace contract built with Anchor 0.18.2 that enables users to list NFTs, update prices, and purchase items while automatically handling marketplace fees and royalty payments. The contract was developed for a 2021 hackathon and may contain outdated code patterns. It provides core marketplace functionality including listing cancellation and NFT transfers on the Solana blockchain.

repos.name: classification
repos.summary: A Laravel-based system for classifying company attributes that uses an attribution classifier to categorize company data. The project includes a Company model, a Classification service, and comprehensive feature tests to validate the classification logic using PHPUnit.

repos.name: gabrielkoerich
repos.summary: for Gabriel Koerich, a software engineer and entrepreneur with 17+ years of experience specializing in Rust, Solana smart contracts, and DeFi protocol architecture. The profile highlights his background in founding Bulldesk (acquired 2021) and currently architecting smart contracts at Lulo, a protocol managing over $100M in total value locked.

repos.name: bulldesk-gridsome
repos.summary: Gridsome starter bootstrap is a static site generator template built on Vue.js and GraphQL that combines Bootstrap styling, Markdown content, and Forestry CMS integration for easy deployment to Netlify. It includes pre-configured features like Google Analytics, sitemap generation, and Netlify forms, designed for users who want a fully-featured blog or marketing site without hosting costs. The project emphasizes simplicity by leveraging free tiers from Netlify, Forestry, and GitHub for a complete content management and deployment workflow.

repos.name: granatum-php
repos.description: A PHP 7+ library for the Granatum API.
repos.summary: A PHP 7+ library that provides integration with the Granatum API for financial management operations. It enables developers to interact with Granatum's financial services programmatically through a dedicated PHP interface. The library supports modern PHP versions and simplifies API communication for applications requiring Granatum financial functionality.

repos.name: guidelines
repos.description: My PHP, HTML, CSS and Javascript guidelines.
repos.summary: A repository documenting PHP, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript coding standards and best practices. It provides guidelines for development workflows, code style conventions, documentation formats, and project contribution rules. The standards cover PSR-2 compliance for PHP, semantic HTML structure, proper indentation across languages, and GitHub Flow-based collaboration practices.

repos.name: dotfiles
repos.description: Gabriel's config files (zsh, tmux, git, etc) + backups, brew installs, coding agents and macOS setup.
repos.summary: Configuration management system for macOS that syncs dotfiles, installs development tools, and manages app settings through shell scripts, Brew packages, and coding agent tooling. Provides automated setup for zsh, tmux, Neovim, Ghostty, and SSH configuration with mackup backup integration and security auditing capabilities.

repos.name: gabrielkoerich.github.io
repos.description: Projects & Work
repos.summary: Website code for http://projects.gabrielkoerich.com/.

repos.name: addressing
repos.description: Brazilian postalcode to address in a service manager.
repos.summary: A service manager for converting Brazilian postal codes to addresses. This lightweight library provides functionality to look up address information based on postal codes used in Brazil. Licensed under the MIT License.

repos.name: service-manager
repos.description: A simple way to run services in sequence.
repos.summary: A simple command-line tool for running services in sequence. Service Manager provides an easy way to manage and orchestrate the execution order of multiple services. Licensed under the MIT License.

repos.name: algorit
repos.description: WIP
repos.summary: A WIP project that combines a frontend built with HTML5, Vue.js, Sass, and Pug with a PHP/Lumen backend API. The stack leverages Laravel Elixir for build tooling and aims to create an algorithmic application with modern web technologies.

repos.name: cashier-iugu
repos.description: Iugu integration for Laravel Cashier

repos.name: basedash
repos.summary: A PHP-based dashboard application built with Laravel that provides database management and system administration capabilities. It includes a Node.js and Grunt-powered frontend build system with Bower for dependency management, and comes with comprehensive testing infrastructure via PHPUnit and code quality monitoring tools. The project supports multiple database operations and system synchronization features with automated asset compilation and migration management.

repos.name: bovespa.io
repos.description: bovespa.io
repos.summary: A Laravel-based web application for Brazilian stock market data (bovespa.io) that uses Composer for PHP dependencies, NPM/Bower for frontend assets, and includes database migrations with PHPUnit testing capabilities.

repos.name: algorit.com.br
repos.summary: A Brazilian domain project called algorit.com.br with no available description or README content to summarize.
